content: Singaporean cultural awardAward The **Cultural Medallion** ([Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Pingat Budaya*) is a cultural award in Singapore conferred to those who have achieved artistic excellence in [dance](/wiki/Dance), [theatre](/wiki/Theatre), [literature](/wiki/Literature_of_Singapore), [music](/wiki/Music_of_Singapore), [photography](/wiki/Photography), [art](/wiki/Art) and [film](/wiki/Cinema_of_Singapore). It is widely recognized as Singapore's pinnacle arts award. ## History The award was instituted in March 1979 by Minister for Culture [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) and administered by the [National Arts Council](/wiki/National_Arts_Council_Singapore). The awards was given by the Minister for Culture. Since 2006, the award was presented by the [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) instead of the [Minister for Information, Communications and the Arts](/wiki/Minister_for_Information,_Communications_and_the_Arts) (previously known as Minister for Culture). On 20 October Minister for Information, Communications and the Arts [Lee Boon Yang](/wiki/Lee_Boon_Yang) announced that project grant for the award is revised to S$80,000 upwards from S$50,000, giving recipients better opportunities to create major works. From 2013, in an effort to recognise multi-disciplinary artists, it was announced that recipients of the Cultural Medallion and [Young Artist Award](/wiki/Singapore_Young_Artist_Award) will no longer be categorised according to art forms. ## List of Cultural Medallion recipients YearCategoryNameRef1979Dance[Madhavi Krishnan](/wiki/Madhavi_Krishnan_(dancer))TheatreBani Bin BuangMusic[Choo Hoey](/wiki/Choo_Hoey)[David Lim Kim San](/wiki/David_Lim_Kim_San)Literature[Edwin Nadason Thumboo](/wiki/Edwin_Thumboo)ArtWee Beng Chong1981Dance[Goh Soo Khim](/wiki/Goh_Soo_Khim)Theatre[Joanna Wong Quee Heng](/wiki/Joanna_Wong_Quee_Heng)MusicAhmad bin Ja'afarLiterature[Wong Meng Voon](/wiki/Wong_Meng_Voon)ArtLee Hock Moh[Ng Eng Teng](/wiki/Ng_Eng_Teng)1982Theatre[Lin Chen](/wiki/Lin_Chen_(playwright))MusicLeong Yoon PinLiterature[Goh Poh Seng](/wiki/Goh_Poh_Seng)PhotographyDavid Tay Poey CherArt[Georgette Chen Liying](/wiki/Georgette_Chen)1983TheatreChristopher Henry Rothwell AllenMusicVivien GohLiterature[Arthur Yap](/wiki/Arthur_Yap)PhotographyAng Chwee Chai1984TheatreS.
